title: Application of Self-Explanation and Visualization Techniques for Flexible Transferable Professional Development

context.additional_context: A formative assessment-centered educational program conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze problem-solving processes in complex workplace situations using self-explanation techniques.
Learners can express structural relationships of expert knowledge diagrammatically and identify transferable patterns through visualization techniques.
Learners can enhance the efficiency of professional development by over 20% by applying metacognitive strategies to self-regulate their learning process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
